Rural settlement patterns
A rural settlement pattern refers to whether the farmsteads are grouped 
together or not. There are two rural settlement patterns:
• 
Nucleated pattern: Farmsteads are arranged close to one another. 
Figure 3.2.B (below left) shows a nucleated pattern. These buildings 
are rural, so they cannot be classified as being larger than a hamlet 
or village.
• 
Dispersed pattern: Farmsteads are arranged far apart from one 
another. Figure 3.2.C (below right) shows a dispersed pattern.  
This can only be an isolated farmstead – this is one farm house, 
stables or sheds or kraals, and surrounding fields.
